MatchedRegions.transcript: We collect COVID-19 related tweets ranging from February 1, 2020 to September 30, 2021.

MatchedRegion.Text: Data source: Tweet ID came from an open-source database (Chen et al., 2020a).
All the tweets are downloaded following Twitter's automation rules and data security policy.
Filter out the tweets containing URLs
Use a list of symptoms as keywords to match the tweets to extract medical- related tweets.
4000 are from the model labeled data (manually checked)
3 general entity types: Person, Location, and Organization
4 medical entity types: Disease, Drug, Symptom, and Vaccine

Emily Chen, Kristina Lerman, and Emilio Ferrara. 2020a. Tracking Social Media Discourse About the COVID-19 Pandemic: Development of a Public Coronavirus Twitter Data Set. JMIR Public Health Surveill 6, 2 (29 May 2020), e19273. Jie Yang, Yue Zhang, Linwei Li, and Xingxuan Li. 2018b. YEDDA: A Lightweight Collaborative Text Span Annotation Tool. In Proceedings of ACL 2018, System Demonstrations Association for Computational Linguistics, Melbourne,

MatchedRegions.transcript: In particular, we select four entity types for additional sentiment annotation with three types of sentiment labels, positive, negative, neutral.
